## Discussion

The roll angle represents the side-to-side tilt of the face relative to the metadata’s bounding rectangle. A value of `0.0` yields a face that is level relative to the picture, whereas a value of `90` yields a face that is perpendicular relative to the picture.

You must check the value of the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVMetadataFaceObject/hasRollAngle] property before accessing this property. If the value in the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVMetadataFaceObject/hasRollAngle] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], reading the value in this property raises an exception.

# rollAngle

**Instance Property**

The roll angle of the face specified in degrees.

## Declaration

```swift
var rollAngle: CGFloat { get }
```

## Discussion

The roll angle represents the side-to-side tilt of the face relative to the metadata’s bounding rectangle. A value of `0.0` yields a face that is level relative to the picture, whereas a value of `90` yields a face that is perpendicular relative to the picture.

You must check the value of the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVMetadataFaceObject/hasRollAngle] property before accessing this property. If the value in the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVMetadataFaceObject/hasRollAngle] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], reading the value in this property raises an exception.

## Accessing the face detection data

- **hasRollAngle**: A Boolean value indicating whether there is a valid roll angle associated with the face.
- **hasYawAngle**: A Boolean value indicating whether there is a valid yaw angle associated with the face.
- **yawAngle**: The yaw angle of the face specified in degrees.
